Edit the item
Add new item
Wash the item in a standard wash cycle, with no water temperature restrictions
Do not wash the item by hand or in a machine. Look to the dry clean symbols on the tag for further care instructions
Wash the item by hand, with detergent and warm water in a small tub or sink, and should not be washed in a machine
Wash the item by hand, with detergent and cold water (max 30°C or 60–80°F) in a small tub or sink, and should not be washed in a machine
Wash the item by hand, with detergent and warm water (max 40°C or 90–110°F) in a small tub or sink, and should not be washed in a machine
Wash the item in cold water (max 30°C or 80°F)
Wash the item in warm water (max 40°C or 110°F)
Wash the item in hot water (max 50°C or 120°F)
Wash the item in hot water (max 60°C or 140°F)
Wash the item in hot water (max 70°C or 160°F)
Wash the item in hot water (max 95°C or 200°F)
Wash the item in a permanent press cycle and cold water (max 30°C or 80°F), intended to protect garments prone to wrinkling, color-fading, shrinking, and stretching
Wash the item in a delicate cycle, which uses cold water (max 30°C or 80°F) and low agitation to be gentle on fabrics like silk, wool, and synthetic materials
Wash the item in a permanent press cycle and warm water (max 40°C or 110°F), intended to protect garments prone to wrinkling, color-fading, shrinking, and stretching
Wash the item in a delicate cycle, which uses cold water (max 40°C or 110°F) and low agitation to be gentle on fabrics like silk, wool, and synthetic materials
Wash the item in a permanent press cycle and warm water (max 50°C or 120°F), intended to protect garments prone to wrinkling, color-fading, shrinking, and stretching
Wash the item in a permanent press cycle and warm water (max 60°C or 140°F), intended to protect garments prone to wrinkling, color-fading, shrinking, and stretching
Wash the item in a permanent press cycle and warm water (max 95°C or 200°F), intended to protect garments prone to wrinkling, color-fading, shrinking, and stretching
Bleach can be used on the item
Only use non-chlorine bleach, which uses hydrogen peroxide instead of sodium hypochlorite, on the item
Do not use any kind of bleach on the item
Dry the item in a dryer in a standard setting. No temperature restrictions
Dry the item in a dryer on low heat (max 40°C or 110°F)
Dry the item in a dryer on medium heat (max 60°C or 140°F)
Dry the item in a dryer on high heat (max 80°C or 170°F)
Dry the item in a dryer with no heat. The setting on your machine may also be called "air fluff" or "air dry"
Dry the item in a permanent press cycle and warm water (max 40°C or 110°F), intended to protect garments prone to wrinkling, color-fading, shrinking, and stretching
Dry the item in a delicate cycle, which uses cold water (max 40°C or 110°F)
Wash the item in a permanent press cycle and warm water (max 60°C or 140°F), intended to protect garments prone to wrinkling, color-fading, shrinking, and stretching
Hang the item on a line to air-dry
Keep out of direct sunlight
Hang the item on a line to air-dry, but keep out of direct sunlight
Hang the item on a line to dry, without any smoothing and shaping. Items with this symbol on the tag are made of fabric that dries free of creases and wrinkles
Hang the item on a line to dry, without any smoothing and shaping, but keep out of direct sunlight
Lay the item on a flat, horizontal surface to air-dry. This helps protect fabrics like wool or knitwear, from stretching out and getting misshapen when wet
Lay the item on a flat, horizontal surface to air-dry, but keep out of direct sunlight
Do not dry the item in the dryer. Look to the accompanying drying symbols on the tag for further care instructions
The item can be ironed at any temperature
The item can be ironed at a low temperature (max 110°C or 230°F)
The item can be ironed at a medium temperature (max 150°C or 300°F)
The item can be ironed at a high temperature (max 200°C or 390°F)
Do not use an iron on the item
The item should be ironed without the use of steam.
Have the item professionally dry-cleaned. Do not wash or dry the item in a machine
Your dry cleaner can use any solvent to clean the material
Your dry cleaner can use any solvent except anything specifically listed
Your dry cleaner can use petroleum based solvents. This is usually needed for fine, delicate fabrics that can be damaged by solvents used in standard dry cleaning
The item should be professionally dry-cleaned on a short cycle
The item should be professionally dry-cleaned on low heat
The item should be professionally dry-cleaned on a reduced-moisture cycle
The item should not be steamed after the dry-cleaning process
Do not professionally dry-clean the item. Look for other washing and drying symbols on the tag for further instruction
